title: Scientists identify gene partnerships that promote spinal cord regeneration

title_detail.value: Scientists identify gene partnerships that promote spinal cord regeneration

summary: Scientists have identified gene 'partners' in the axolotl salamander that, when activated, allow the neural tube and associated nerve fibers to functionally regenerate after severe spinal cord damage. Interestingly, these genes are also present in humans, though they are activated in a different manner.
